headline: Nvidia takes $2 billion stake in Synopsys as AI deal spree accelerates
summary: Nvidia has invested $2 billion in chip design software maker Synopsys as part of ​an expanded multi-year tie-up to jointly develop new tools ‌for designing products across industries using its AI technology. Synopsys shares rose 7% in premarket trading, while those of Nvidia fell nearly 2%.

headline: Synopsys Just the Latest to Strike a Deal With Nvidia. What It Means for the Stock.
summary: Nvidia  said Monday that it had taken a $2 billion stake in  Synopsys  part of an expanded partnership that could see artificial intelligence play a bigger role in industrial design and engineering.  Synopsys stock rose 4.% to $438.55 at 2:42 p.m. Monday, while shares of Nvidia, the leading maker of chips for artificial intelligence, were up 0.1.2% at $179.14.  Nvidia said it had invested $2 billion in Synopsys common stock at a purchase price of $414.79 a share.

headline: Nvidia Buys $2B of Synopsys Stock, DeepSeek Debuts New AI Models
summary: Nvidia Corp. invested $2 billion in Synopsys Inc. as part of a broader engineering and design tie-up, aiming to infuse its AI-computing technology into more industries. The new partnership involves integrating Nvidia's tools into Synopsys' chip-design applications, and the companies will deploy AI agents and work on joint marketing. While elsewhere, DeepSeek unveiled two new versions of an experimental artificial-intelligence model aimed at rivaling Google and OpenAI. 'Bloomberg Tech' Co-host Ed Ludlow joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it all down.
